meanings.definition: The state or quality of being everywhere at once.
meanings.sent1: The ubiquitousness of technology allows us to connect with people all around the world.
meanings.sent2: The ubiquitousness of fast food restaurants makes it easy to grab a quick meal on the go.
meanings.sent3: His claim of having the ubiquitousness of a superhero was met with laughter from his friends.
meanings.sent4: The ubiquitousness of her laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's ubiquitousness in the school hallways ensured that students felt supported and safe.

meanings.definition: The fact of appearing everywhere or of being very common.
meanings.sent1: The ubiquitousness of advertisements can be overwhelming at times.
meanings.sent2: In big cities, the ubiquitousness of skyscrapers is a common sight.
meanings.sent3: The ubiquitousness of his jokes made him the class clown.
meanings.sent4: The ubiquitousness of her kindness touched the hearts of everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The musician's ubiquitousness in the music industry made her a household name.
